TopicTitle: Where did the Salyut footage go?

Articles.Content:
In the 70's and early 80's in an attempt to regain lost prestige from Apollo, the Soviets opened up unprecedented amounts of data for the civilian Salyut program in the form of photos, video footage, scientific data and heavily publicised everything in the Union and international community. The tended to show a lot of live footage on TV similar to today with the ISS. This was done heavily on Salyut 1 were they broadcasted live every night for an hour doing experiments and showing the Soviet public how to live in space. However if you try to search for this data today you cannot find it. No videos, hardly any pictures, you can still find scientific results. But what happened to all this footage, there should be at least 21 hours of TV footage for S-1 and then all the non public footage. Where did it go?

EDIT: I should note why I want this footage, I'm the kind of guy that can spend hours watching this stuff, it fascinates me
About the only thing I've seen (YouTube) are clips of Russian launch fails, and the tribute to Uri Gagarin's first flight... a move called "First Orbit"..... which is definately worth watching.
